text: Organizations are increasingly adopting Apache Kafka
to capture and analyze real-time data streams
from sources like IoT devices, website clickstreams,
financial systems, and database logs.
Tens of thousands of customers use Amazon MSK,
a fully managed service for Apache Kafka,
to build and run highly available, secure,
and scalable applications.
However, for unpredictable or unknown workloads,
provisioning cluster capacity can be a guessing game.
Introducing Amazon MSK Serverless,
a serverless option for Amazon MSK.
With MSK Serverless,
you can run Apache Kafka without managing cluster capacity.
Create a MSK Serverless cluster in just a few clicks—
using new or existing Apache Kafka applications to stream data—
and MSK Serverless automatically provisions and manages
the required resources,
giving you on-demand streaming capacity and storage.
Scale your application as streaming data volumes change—
without continuously right-sizing clusters
or worrying about over-provisioning.
Plus, with MSK Serverless’ throughput-based pricing,
you only pay for what you use.
Learn more on our website.
